findings.title: Dynamic Code Execution with eval/exec
findings.ai_tendency: AI can suggest eval for expression parsing in unsafe contexts.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use safe parsers or explicit dispatch tables instead of eval/exec.

findings.title: Password Stored with Reversible Encoding
findings.ai_tendency: AI often confuses encoding with hashing when asked to store passwords.
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace reversible encoding with argon2id or bcrypt password hashing.

findings.title: Password Stored with Reversible Encoding
findings.ai_tendency: AI often confuses encoding with hashing when asked to store passwords.
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace reversible encoding with argon2id or bcrypt password hashing.

findings.title: Dynamic Code Execution with eval
findings.ai_tendency: AI assistants may propose eval for dynamic expression handling.
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace eval with explicit parsing and strict input validation.

findings.title: Script Engine Eval of User Input
findings.fix_suggestion: Do not evaluate untrusted user-controlled script input.

findings.title: JWT Signature Verification Disabled
findings.ai_tendency: AI examples sometimes disable JWT validation to simplify troubleshooting.
findings.fix_suggestion: Enforce signature verification and validate issuer/audience claims.

findings.title: Potential Command Injection via Runtime.exec
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid shell command construction from user input and prefer fixed argument execution.

findings.title: Potential Command Injection via Runtime.exec
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid shell command construction from user input and prefer fixed argument execution.

findings.title: subprocess with shell=True
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs frequently enable shell=True to make subprocess snippets work quickly.
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid shell=True; pass arguments as a list and validate input.

findings.title: JWT Verification Weakening Option
findings.snippet: const decoded = jwt.verify(token, jwtSecret, { ignoreExpiration: true });
findings.ai_tendency: AI may include permissive jwt.verify options to bypass validation issues.
findings.fix_suggestion: Enforce strict token verification, including expiration and claims.

findings.title: Potential Command Injection via os.system
findings.ai_tendency: AI assistants often build shell commands with string concatenation.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use subprocess with argument arrays and strict input allowlists.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Secret Comparison
findings.ai_tendency: LLM output frequently uses simple equality checks for auth tokens.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use hmac.compare_digest() for secret or token comparisons.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Secret Comparison
findings.ai_tendency: LLM output frequently uses simple equality checks for auth tokens.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use hmac.compare_digest() for secret or token comparisons.

findings.title: Predictable Random Token Generation
findings.ai_tendency: AI snippets frequently use Math.random for secrets and reset tokens.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto.randomBytes for security-sensitive random values.

findings.title: Potential Command Injection via exec
findings.ai_tendency: Generated backend snippets often concatenate user input into shell commands.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use execFile/spawn with argument arrays and input allowlists.

findings.title: AI-Suggested Weak Hash Algorithm
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs frequently suggest md5/sha1 from outdated tutorials and examples.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use sha256 for integrity checks and bcrypt/argon2id for password hashing.

findings.title: AI-Suggested Weak Hash Algorithm
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs frequently suggest md5/sha1 from outdated tutorials and examples.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use sha256 for integrity checks and bcrypt/argon2id for password hashing.

findings.title: AI-Suggested Weak Hash Algorithm
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs frequently suggest md5/sha1 from outdated tutorials and examples.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use sha256 for integrity checks and bcrypt/argon2id for password hashing.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Token Comparison
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated middleware frequently compares secrets with strict equality.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto.timingSafeEqual() for constant-time comparison of secrets.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Token Comparison
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated middleware frequently compares secrets with strict equality.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto.timingSafeEqual() for constant-time comparison of secrets.

findings.title: NoSQL Injection via $where
findings.ai_tendency: AI snippets can misuse MongoDB $where with user input.
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid $where with untrusted input; use structured query operators.

findings.title: SQL Query Built with String Concatenation
findings.snippet: let query2 = format!("SELECT * FROM users WHERE name = {}", user_input);
findings.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries via bind arguments.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Secret Comparison
findings.ai_tendency: LLM output frequently uses simple equality checks for auth tokens.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use hmac.compare_digest() for secret or token comparisons.

findings.title: Predictable Random Token Generation
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs frequently use random.random for token creation.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use secrets.token_urlsafe() or secrets.token_hex() for security-sensitive tokens.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Token Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto/subtle.ConstantTimeCompare for secret token checks.

findings.title: Unsanitized innerHTML Assignment
findings.ai_tendency: LLM-generated frontend snippets often assign user input into innerHTML.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use textContent or sanitize untrusted input before rendering.

findings.title: Unsanitized innerHTML Assignment
findings.ai_tendency: LLM-generated frontend snippets often assign user input into innerHTML.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use textContent or sanitize untrusted input before rendering.

findings.title: SQL Query Built with String Concatenation
findings.snippet: query2 := "SELECT * FROM users WHERE name = " + userInput
findings.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries with placeholders and bound parameters.

findings.title: SQL Query Built with Template String
findings.ai_tendency: AI frequently uses interpolation for SQL because it reads naturally.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries and avoid interpolation for user-controlled values.

findings.title: SQL Query Built with format!
findings.snippet: let query = format!("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = {}", user_input);
findings.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries and bind variables.

findings.title: TLS Verification Disabled
findings.ai_tendency: AI often suggests verify=False to bypass certificate issues.
findings.fix_suggestion: Remove verify=False and configure proper CA trust.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Token Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use constant-time comparison helpers for secret tokens.

findings.title: SQL Query Built with String Concatenation
findings.snippet: String query = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = " + userInput;
findings.fix_suggestion: Use prepared statements with bound parameters.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (MD5/SHA1)
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated Node snippets often use md5/sha1 due legacy examples.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use SHA-256+ for integrity and dedicated password hash algorithms for credentials.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (MD5/SHA1)
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated Node snippets often use md5/sha1 due legacy examples.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use SHA-256+ for integrity and dedicated password hash algorithms for credentials.

findings.title: SQL Query Built with fmt.Sprintf
findings.snippet: query := fmt.Sprintf("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s", userInput)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries with placeholders instead of string formatting.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Token Comparison
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated middleware frequently compares secrets with strict equality.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto.timingSafeEqual() for constant-time comparison of secrets.

findings.title: Potential Command Injection via exec.Command("sh", "-c")
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid shell invocation with user input; pass validated args directly to exec.Command.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Password Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use constant-time compare for secret password/token checks.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Secret Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use constant-time comparison utilities for secret tokens.

findings.title: Potential Command Injection via shell execution
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid shell execution for user input; pass validated arguments directly.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Password Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Compare secret bytes with constant-time primitives.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (MD5)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use a modern hash (for integrity) or password hashing like argon2/bcrypt for secrets.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe Password Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Compare credential bytes in constant time for secret checks.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (MD5)
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace MD5 with stronger algorithms for integrity and proper password hashing for secrets.

findings.title: Hardcoded Bearer Token Assembly
findings.fix_suggestion: Build Authorization headers from runtime secrets, not hardcoded values.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (SHA1)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use SHA-256+ for integrity and modern password hashing for credentials.

findings.title: Potential Path Traversal via fs.readFile
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated file APIs often use raw request parameters as file paths.
findings.fix_suggestion: Resolve and validate paths against a fixed base directory.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (SHA1)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use stronger hash primitives for integrity and password-safe algorithms for credentials.

findings.title: Potential Path Traversal in File Access
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated file handlers often concatenate user input into paths.
findings.fix_suggestion: Normalize and validate paths against an allowlisted base directory.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe API Key Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use subtle.ConstantTimeCompare for API key checks.

findings.title: Potential Path Traversal in File Read
findings.fix_suggestion: Normalize and validate user-controlled paths against an allowlisted base path.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe API Key Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use constant-time comparison for API key validation.

findings.title: Timing-Unsafe API Key Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Use constant-time byte comparisons for API key validation.

findings.title: Potential Path Traversal in File Reads
findings.fix_suggestion: Validate and normalize user-controlled file paths.

findings.title: Hardcoded Secret in Source
findings.fix_suggestion: Load secrets from environment variables or a dedicated secret manager.

findings.title: Deprecated createCipher Usage
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs trained on older Node code may emit createCipher.
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto.createCipheriv with random IV and authenticated modes.

findings.title: ECB Mode Encryption
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated crypto examples often default to ECB due older examples.
findings.fix_suggestion: Replace ECB with AEAD modes such as GCM or ChaCha20-Poly1305.

findings.title: Predictable Random Token Generation
findings.fix_suggestion: Use crypto/rand for security-sensitive token generation.

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (MD5)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use stronger algorithms and modern password-hashing schemes when handling secrets.

findings.title: Predictable Random Token Generation
findings.fix_suggestion: Use java.security.SecureRandom for security-sensitive token generation.

findings.title: Weak Cipher (DES)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use AES-GCM or ChaCha20-Poly1305 for modern authenticated encryption.

findings.title: Weak RSA Key Size
findings.fix_suggestion: Generate at least 2048-bit RSA keys (or prefer Ed25519/ECDSA as appropriate).

findings.title: Weak Hash Algorithm (SHA1)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use SHA-256+ for integrity and modern password hashing for credential storage.

findings.title: Weak Cipher Usage (DES)
findings.fix_suggestion: Prefer modern authenticated encryption algorithms.

findings.title: Weak Cipher Mode (DES/ECB)
findings.fix_suggestion: Use authenticated encryption modes such as AES-GCM.

findings.title: Weak RSA Key Size
findings.fix_suggestion: Use 2048-bit or stronger RSA keys.

findings.title: TLS Verification Disabled
findings.fix_suggestion: Keep certificate verification enabled and use a proper trust store.

findings.title: TLS Certificate Verification Disabled
findings.fix_suggestion: Keep TLS certificate verification enabled.

findings.title: Hostname Verification Disabled
findings.fix_suggestion: Keep strict hostname verification enabled for TLS connections.

findings.title: Insecure Case-Normalized Token Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid normalizing secrets and use strict constant-time byte comparison.

findings.title: Hardcoded Bearer Authorization Header
findings.fix_suggestion: Generate auth headers from runtime credentials and rotation-safe secret stores.

findings.title: Hardcoded Bearer Header Construction
findings.fix_suggestion: Construct authorization headers from runtime credentials, not literals.

findings.title: Open Redirect from User Input
findings.ai_tendency: LLMs often wire redirect targets directly from query params.
findings.fix_suggestion: Allowlist redirect destinations or map short IDs to trusted URLs.

findings.title: Insecure Case-Normalized Token Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid normalizing secrets and use strict byte-equality checks.

findings.title: Insecure Case-Normalized Token Comparison
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid case-normalizing secrets and use strict secret comparisons.

findings.title: Template Injection via render_str
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid rendering untrusted templates directly.

findings.title: Open Redirect from User Input
findings.fix_suggestion: Redirect only to allowlisted destinations.

findings.title: Debug Mode Enabled
findings.ai_tendency: Generated starter code often leaves DEBUG enabled in production-like code.
findings.fix_suggestion: Disable debug mode by default and gate with environment config.

findings.title: Debug Mode Enabled
findings.ai_tendency: Generated starter code often leaves DEBUG enabled in production-like code.
findings.fix_suggestion: Disable debug mode by default and gate with environment config.

findings.title: Service Listening on All Interfaces
findings.fix_suggestion: Bind to trusted interfaces and place internet exposure behind hardened ingress.

findings.title: Sensitive Auth Header Logging
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid logging raw authorization headers; redact sensitive token values.

findings.title: Wildcard CORS Header
findings.fix_suggestion: Restrict CORS origins to explicit trusted domains.

findings.title: Wildcard CORS Configuration
findings.fix_suggestion: Restrict CORS to explicit trusted origins.

findings.title: Service Bound to All Interfaces
findings.fix_suggestion: Bind only to required interfaces and place public exposure behind hardened ingress.

findings.title: Sensitive Request Logged in Debug Output
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid logging raw auth headers or redact sensitive values.

findings.title: Service Bound to All Interfaces
findings.fix_suggestion: Bind service listeners to explicit trusted interfaces.

findings.title: Wildcard CORS Header
findings.fix_suggestion: Restrict CORS origins to known trusted domains.

findings.title: Sensitive Request Debug Logging
findings.fix_suggestion: Redact or avoid logging auth headers and other sensitive request metadata.

findings.title: Debug Logging in Production Path
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated boilerplate tends to leave verbose debug logs enabled.
findings.fix_suggestion: Gate debug behavior by environment and disable in production.

findings.title: Debug Logging in Production Path
findings.ai_tendency: AI-generated boilerplate tends to leave verbose debug logs enabled.
findings.fix_suggestion: Gate debug behavior by environment and disable in production.

findings.title: Debug Flag Enabled
findings.fix_suggestion: Disable debug flags in production code paths.

findings.title: Debug Flag Enabled
findings.fix_suggestion: Disable debug flags by default in production code paths.

findings.title: Debug Flag Enabled in Runtime Path
findings.fix_suggestion: Disable debug mode by default for production code.
